Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is thickly caked with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of twelve lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing an order for payment.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.147-8)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87666) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87666)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 186 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
